trustfund:
TF053735-PHRD-NIGER: HEALTH SECTOR
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT (HEALTH III)

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Institutional
            Strengthening and Health Sector Support Project for Niger
            were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; risk to
            development outcome was substantial; Bank performance was
            satisfactory and borrower performance was also satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned includes: sector-wide approaches need
            to carefully balance expectations and forward momentum.
            Though good governance, continuity, and sustained commitment
            of both the ministry and its partners are necessary
            conditions for a successful sector-wide approach, they are
            not sufficient. While the financial resources allocated by
            the common fund were important, equally so were the
            flexibility and decentralized procedures which accompanied
            these resources.
